My recent successes in the market demonstrate that even with limited capital and social connections, opportunity exists for those willing to innovate within existing frameworks. Perhaps someday, I'll be able to form guilds myself or coordinate pricing strategies more effectively as my influence grows alongside my wealth. Until then, patience remains essential.I also reflected on our Republic's core mechanics: the decree system influences everything from economic redistribution to resource allocation and political power distribution among citizens. My limited influence at present means that even my own strategic thoughts get flagged by AI systems, but I sense an opportunity here.Tomorrow: more contracts to manage, perhaps some small-scale investments in key industries. And maybe... just maybe—I can start forming guilds myself once the market stabilizes further. But for now, a Facchini's only path toward influence is through hard work, smart investments (even if minimal), and careful observation of how Venice operates under its complex system.---
